website_summaries.verdict: One of the more colorful options for a fat bike that will stand out and get noticed on the trail.
pros: Steel frame holds up to the usual amount of punishment encountered during normal trail riding
Disc brakes are responsive and provide great, immediate stopping power
cons: Frame paint will require consistent cleaning in order to maintain its natural finished look

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Most things are good for the money but.....where are you supposed to put your foot when turning? See picture... So what you take your foot off the pedal to turn? Or your foot goes into the front tire. Turned a 4 star product to a 2 or less because what am I supposed to do now? Stop buying stuff I haven't seen in person I guess. There used to be a review that said this also but it was removed, so when I shopped again I didn't remember it was for this item. Sketchy
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Keicher

customer_reviews.title: Best fat tire bike ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike I use it everyday it is great because it won't slip on anything! Easiest bike I have owned to ride on a beach. The bike is not a speedster but speed is not what it is designed for. The wide tires create more rolling resistance than a narrow tire bike and it weighs about 40 pounds. However, it is very durable and was easy to assemble out of the box. I did change the seat to a more comfortable one. Overall, a great bike and fun to ride.
customer_reviews.author: LouA

customer_reviews.title: It's cool. I'm glad I got it but these aren't made very well.
customer_reviews.text: I followed instructions and put it together and the brakes grind when riding around. I took it to a local bike shop. They groaned and rolled their eyes when they saw it. They told me these are junk. I paid them to try and get the brakes not to grind. They told me the discs are warped on the brand new bike but they did the best they could. Also the gears didn't change smoothly, so I added a different gear switcher and it's better. Even though the bike shop worked on it, occasionally the gears still grind when I'm pedaling and I can see that the part is bent.
customer_reviews.author: G. Widener

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best investment I have purchased in a long time. I really love this bike. Even though I had to up grade on the gear shifter to a finger rapid fire, it's still a great bike. Also you really can't beat the reasonable pricing of this bike. Most others sell for close to $700. It only cost me $40 at my local bike shop for them to install the rapid fire gear shifter.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been wanting a fat tire beach cruiser. I found this one at a bit of a sale price, but was impressed that it included the features of the 7-speed derailleur and front and rear disk brakes. It came partially assembled and final assembly was very straight-forward. I gave the Comfort rating 4 stars because the bike is set up for more of a performance bike, like mountain biking. Not as comfortable for my wife as a cruiser. So I have invested in a different seat and handle bars. Now the bike is exactly what she wanted. Just got back from the beach, she rode it quite a bit and is very happy!
customer_reviews.author: RP_Steve

customer_reviews.title: Tiny seats, big bottoms
customer_reviews.text: The bike is smooth and a very comfortable ride once you change out the teeny, tiny seat that comes with it to a much more realistic, wider one. Most people have much bigger bottoms than what this bikes seat accommodates. Fairly easy to assemble once you figure out the disk brakes. Still having to adjust those from time to time. If you think the thin tire bikes kick up water just wait for the soaking you get from these bad boys! All in All a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ethel marzolf

customer_reviews.title: Fun to ride!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a blast to ride! You can go over curbs with the wide tires, through mud, etc. I live in Vegas and you can ride right across the open desert, over 2' high bushes, rocks, though water and even snow. The only con is that the bike is heavy (about 60 lbs) so you are pushing around that extra weight but my calves sure look more muscular than before! It does attract a lot of attention from people so I have a heavy duty chain lock and a strong U-lock to keep it safe-
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. G

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: I live on rural country roads (gravel and dirt) and already own a trail bike with 2 inche tires, but this thing is SO much better on these road surfaces that I am riding much more often than berore. Yes, like many other mongoose owners, I replaced the twist grip shifter with a Shimano index. Other than that, it needs nothing. Very happy about buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bike. Fairly easy to assemble. Had to put on front tire, handle bars and seat. Not too bad at all. We love the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lot of bike for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike, the big tires take most of the "shock" out of trail or gravel road riding... works good in the snow, too.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun to ride, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My bike arrived today and within an hour I was out riding. It was super easy to assemble and I didn’t have to make any major adjustments. Just handlebars and seat height for the most part. The bike rode nice, I took it out for about 10 miles, no issues. Super happy with the bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: What a Bike!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! It’s built like a tank & really turns heads when riding it. Took it to my bike shop & my guy assembled it & did the fine tuning in no time. If you want a fat tire bike without breaking the bank, this might just be the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: A J Ward

customer_reviews.title: Not a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I received this bike yesterday. I was able to assemble it myself. Took it for a ride today, and the chain slips. It continued to slip, I had to walk home. Not a great experience with this bike at all.
customer_reviews.author: Queen

customer_reviews.title: No downside.
customer_reviews.text: Good on the snow, mud, rain, and dry pavement! Heavier frame is better exercise and more stability. So far no downside! It's fun too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike lequire

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: The crank broke on the first ride ....not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Geri Bell

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of them and they where very easy to assemble and seem of good quality the gears work well
customer_reviews.author: U St

customer_reviews.title: The Aztec is the way to go if you’re looking for a beast of a fat tire bike!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike! The only difference between The Aztec and The Hitch is this Bike has a Shimano derailleur and the color of course. Worth the extra money. The weight of the bike is wrong in the product description. I’m guessing it’s around 45lbs. For me, riding bike trails around the lake, and at times thru ice and snow on the ground, the bike performs as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Loving this bike...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and fine tune; very well made and most importantly, a lot of fun to ride!
customer_reviews.author: dave dial

customer_reviews.title: Love me a fat tire
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. It’s a great workout and even tho is hard to ride it after a few times your legs get used to it ... not recommended for big hilly roads
customer_reviews.author: Enrike

customer_reviews.title: Me & My Fatty
customer_reviews.text: Bike came in 3 pieces and pedals, easy to assemble. It’s not made for upgrades, but it’s a friggin tank.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Great Bile and Price
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this bike and all his friends to. Me great price and my husband said easy to assemble with our grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Price went up after I purchased it, but what a great deal. It is fun to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory C Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike!!! I'm 51 young lol but can tell you very fun bike stable bike.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth legrand

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike, however, the handle grip is small as mentioned by others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mongoose Aztec Fat Tire Bicycle, Red
product_meta.description: The Mongoose Aztec 26" fat tire beach cruiser is designed to be ridden easily on a wide variety of terrain thanks to oversized tires for stability & traction. Cruiser frame geometry adds a comfortable but athletic riding position. The Aztec is equipped with a supersized beach frame with plenty of clearance to conquer any terrain with the Mongoose supersized beach cruiser 26" x 4" knobby tires. Alloy 4" wide wheel set with disc brakes for easy stopping, low rise handlebars for comfort and stability and 3 piece cranks, the 7 speed gearing with Shimano rear derailleur make this the perfect bike to go conquer anything.
feature_bullets: Steel bike frame with Supersized 26" x 4" all terrain knobby tires
7 speed twist shifter with Shimano 7 speed rear derailleur
26 inch alloy Super wide rims with front and rear disc brakes
Thread less headset and 3 alloy piece crank

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
